programmes.show_description: Kick back and relax with some mellow moments. Chilled to perfection.
Every track a smash hit, every video a UK chart number one. What more could you possibly need in life?
Every track a smash hit, every video a UK chart number one in the 00s. What more could you possibly need in life!
Every existing video from the 40th NOW That's What I Call Music album - in order! Starting with Grease & ending with the classic Los Umbrellos... ending with what?
The standout chart music that defined the decade - from indie rock, singer-songwriters & girl bands to dance, R&B and the early emergence of UK garage & grime.
Oklahoma boys Isaac, Taylor & Zac choose 20 of their 90s favourites. Whitney Houston, Prince & Take That are all present - but standby for a few other surprises!
60 minutes of back-to-back number 1s from 2008. It was the year of the K, including Kanye West, Kid Rock, Katy Perry & Kings of Leon! With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
Loads of your favourite hits during the 00s were just cover versions of old songs for acts like Madonna, Girls Aloud & Adele, but can you recall who did the originals? Let's see!
From little monsters to global chart domination! Starting back in 2009, we celebrate the iconic music & artistry from the awesome 'Haus of Gaga'!
Danger! High Voltage! Prepare to go Bonkers with 30 of the silliest songs of the decade, including Cha Cha Slide, The Ketchup Song & My Humps. Warning: contains the Crazy Frog!
Popcorn at the ready, these are the biggest songs from the movies. But don't forget to switch off your mobile phone!
The 80s & 90s were the golden decades for movie songs - but there were still a few in the 00s - some well remembered, and some not! Here are 25, including 3 Bond themes.
Join us for a spectacular musical journey, a special video showcase highlighting the iconic Number One hits of one of Britain's most beloved pop bands, Take That!
Kick back and relax with some mellow moments. Chilled to perfection.
60 minutes of back-to-back runners-up from 1990 - from Deee-Lite & Technotronic to Luciano Pavarotti, Madonna & Kylie! With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
60 minutes of back to back runners up from 1992 - from The KLF to Kris Kross to Mariah Carey! Helping to Heal The World is Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
All I Want For Christmas is 60 minutes of back to back runners up from 1994 - from The Three Musketeers to Mariah - with Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
60 minutes of back to back runners up from 1996 - from The Bluetones to Toni Braxton via Robbie, George & Gabrielle. With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
60 minutes of back to back runners up from 1998 - Turn It Up with big hits from Busta Rhymes, Bamboo & The Beautiful South. With Mr Charts himself - Mark Goodier.
Cheese lovers unite! Relive 1990-2009 with mozzarella melodies, brie-lliant chart-toppers and the cheesiest guilty pleasures around!
The 00s had a massive 275 songs reach number 1 across the decade - a record - so there are bound to be a few you've long forgotten. Anyone remember David Sneddon, Meck or Orson?
Popcorn at the ready, these are the biggest songs from the movies. But don't forget to switch off your mobile phone!
Radio 1 legend Bruno Brookes returns with a countdown of the 20 biggest singles of the decade. Including big million-selling hits from Britney, Cher & Elton John.
There's nothing quite like a cheesy good party... Unless its a 90s cheesy party that is!! These are the greatest party anthems from the 90s. Fact!
In order - 4 hours of the biggest karaoke anthems of the 90s - from EMF & Happy Mondays to Ricky Martin & 5ive. Prepare to sing out loud!
Jenny raided the NOW video archives for 40 of her favourite 00s party poppers! Whatever your flavour she's definitely got this party covered!
Dust off your flip phones and get ready to dance the day away with the ultimate collection of hits that'll transport you back to those unforgettable millenium parties!
